title: Newton's Theory of Gravity
description: Newton's law of universal gravitation states that every particle attracts every other particle in the universe with a force directly proportional to the product of their masses and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between them.

connections.title: Universal Law
connections.description: Newton's concept of a universal law governing celestial and terrestrial motion

connections.title: Inverse Square Law
connections.description: The mathematical formulation showing force decreases with the square of distance

connections.title: Action at a Distance
connections.description: Newton's controversial concept that gravity acts across space without a medium

connections.title: Absolute Space
connections.description: Newton's conception of space as an absolute, immovable frame of reference

connections.title: Absolute Time
connections.description: Newton's conception of time as flowing uniformly without relation to external objects

connections.title: Mathematical Principles
connections.description: Newton's mathematical approach to physical problems in the Principia

connections.title: Kepler's Laws
connections.description: Kepler's laws of planetary motion that Newton was able to derive from his theory

connections.title: Celestial Mechanics
connections.description: Newton's application of gravitational theory to the motion of celestial bodies

connections.title: Tidal Effects
connections.description: Newton's explanation of tides as resulting from lunar and solar gravitational forces

connections.title: Critique by Leibniz
connections.description: Leibniz's criticisms of Newton's concepts of absolute space and action at a distance

connections.title: Experimental Evidence
connections.description: Newton's use of experimental evidence to support his gravitational theory

connections.title: Pendulum Experiments
